snippet: While some Yemeni officials are skeptical of the impact of shipments of weapons to the Houthi rebels, American officials see the aid as part of a broader Iranian “shadow war.”
abstract: Iran appears to have increased its political outreach and arms shipments to rebels and other political figures in Yemen as part of what American military officials say is a widening Iranian effort to extend its influence across the greater Middle East; scale of Iranian effort is unclear, and some Yemeni officials are skeptical about the impact of any smuggled weapons.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and ROBERT F. WORTH
byline.contributor: Laura Kasinof contributed reporting from Sana and Aden, Yemen.

lead_paragraph: While some Yemeni officials are skeptical of the impact of shipments of weapons to the Houthi rebels, American officials see the aid as part of a broader Iranian “shadow war.”

headline.seo: Aiding Yemen Rebels, Iran Seeks Wider Mideast Role
headline.main: With Arms for Yemen Rebels, Iran Seeks Wider Mideast Role
headline.print_headline: With Arms for Yemen Rebels, Iran Seeks Wider Mideast Role
